alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Eastern Hanover; Western King William; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 3:02PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern King and Queen, southeastern Caroline, southeastern Hanover and northwestern King William Counties through 330 PM EST... At 301 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Studley, or near Mechanicsville, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mechanicsville, Studley, Beulahville, Mangohick, Newtown, Enfield, Owenton, Upshaw, Etna Mills, Epworth, Calno, Gether, Globe, Pollards Corner and Duane Fork. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EST for central, north central and east central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Caroline; Eastern Hanover; Western King William; Western King and Queen
